docs.summary:
The wix-storage module contains functionality for the persistent
 storage of key/value data in the site visitor's browser.
description: There are three types of storage:
+ **Local:** Data in local storage never expires, even if the site visitor
closes your page. When the visitor reopens the page later, the data can still
be retrieved. You can store up to 50kb of data in local storage.
+ **Session:** Data in session storage is available while the site visitor's web
session is active. The session ends when the visitor closes the browser tab
or window. When the session ends, all the data in session storage is lost.
Reloading or restoring the page does not affect session storage data. You
can store up to 50kb of data in session storage.
+ **Memory:** Data in memory storage is available as long the site visitor
does not refresh or close the page. Reloading or restoring the page
clears the memory storage data. You can store up to 1mb of data in memory
storage.
Get hands-on experience with the Storage API on our [Hello Storage](https://www.wix.com/velo/example/hello-storage) example page.
To use the Storage API, import the needed storage type(s) from the
`wix-storage` module:
```javascript
import {local, session, memory} from 'wix-storage';
// Or one of:
import {local} from 'wix-storage';
import {session} from 'wix-storage';
import {memory} from 'wix-storage';
The APIs in `wix-storage` can only be used in front-end code.
Some older browsers may not fully support `wix-storage`. See [Browser compatibility](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Storage#Browser_compatibility)
for more information.
> Learn more about wix-storage in [Getting Started](/getting-started/storage-api) and on [Wix Learn](https://www.wix.com/learn/online-course/coding-with-velo/velo-frontend#use-wix-storage-api).

relatedContent.text: Using the Places API from Google Maps Services

FAQs.title: What's the difference between local, session, and memory storage?
FAQs.markdown:
Local storage persists, even if the visitor closes your site. When the visitor reopens the page later, you can still retrieve data stored in local storage.

Session storage persists as long as the visitor's web session is active. The session ends when the visitor closes the browser tab or window. When the session ends, all the data in session storage is lost. Reloading or restoring the page does not affect session storage data.

Memory storage persists as long the visitor does not refresh or close the page.

FAQs.title: Can I use wix-storage in backend code?
FAQs.markdown: No. Because the data is stored using the site visitor's browser, you cannot directly access this data from backend code. You can, however, access storage data from page code and send it to backend code.

FAQs.title: Is wix-storage data shared between site visitors?
FAQs.markdown: No. When you retrieve data from storage, you only retrieve the data that was stored when the current site visitor was on your site.

FAQs.title: What kind of data can I store using wix-storage?
FAQs.markdown: You can store text data. If you want to store a JSON object, you can first [`stringify()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON/stringify) it to store it as text. Then when you retrieve it as text, you can parse it to convert it to JSON again.

FAQs.title: How do I pass data between pages in my site?
FAQs.markdown: Use the wix-storage API. Use the [`setItem()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/wix-storage.Storage.html#setItem) function to place data in storage on the originating page. Then use the [`getItem()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/wix-storage.Storage.html#getItem) function to retrieve the data on the target page.
